name: ablsimpgd
params: class c0, class c1, wff w0
body: |- wi(w0, wb(wcel(c0, csimpg), wcel(cfv(chash, c1), cprime)))

stmt.origin: impbida(w0, wcel(c0, csimpg), wcel(cfv(chash, c1), cprime))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(wcel(c0, csimpg), wcel(cfv(chash, c1), cprime)))

-| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cfv(chash, c1), cprime)), wcel(c0, csimpg))
body.pretty:
⊢ (w0 →(c0 ∈ SimpGrp ↔(# ` c1)∈ Prime))
⊣ ((w0 ∧ c0 ∈ SimpGrp)→(# ` c1)∈ Prime)
⊣ ((w0 ∧(# ` c1)∈ Prime)→ c0 ∈ SimpGrp)

comment: An abelian group is simple if and only if its order is prime. (Contributed by Rohan Ridenour, 3-Aug-2023.)
